When creating a new SRM connection, the user will get an exception
     eu.geclipse.core.GridException: Unspecified IO problem
	at eu.geclipse.efs.srm.SRMStore.fetchChildren(Unknown Source)
	at eu.geclipse.efs.srm.SRMStore.childNames(Unknown Source)
if he/she choose the wrong port (SRM v1 instead of v2.1 etc). 
See related issue #208546.

It would make sense to "ping" the service before establishing a new connection to make sure we are contacting a valid SRM service, and inform the user if the service is not what it is expected to be.
At least srm v2.2 provides the srmPing() function, hopefully v2.1.1 has the same (didn't check)
